00025 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00026 // Classes and helper functions for the extension mechanism
00027 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00028 // Helper function:
00029 inline unsigned int max_num_extensions(bool increment=false)
00030 {
00031     static unsigned int max_num = 0;
00032     if (increment) ++max_num;
00033     return max_num;
00034 }
00035 
00036 // This class can be used for storing pointers to the extension classes, used
00037 // in tlm_generic_payload:
00038 class tlm_extension_base
00039 {
00040 public:
00041     static unsigned int register_extension()
00042     {
00043         static int extension_index = -1;
00044         max_num_extensions(true);
00045         return (unsigned int)++extension_index;
00046     };
00047 };
00048 
00049 // Base class for all extension classes, derive your extension class in
00050 // the following way:
00051 // class my_extension : public tlm_extension<my_extension> { ...
00052 // This triggers proper extension registration during C++ static
00053 // contruction time. my_extension::ID will hold the unique index in the
00054 // tlm_generic_payload::m_extensions array.
00055 template <typename T>
00056 class tlm_extension : public tlm_extension_base
00057 {
00058 public:
00059     const static unsigned int ID;
00060 };
00061 
00062 template <typename T>
00063 const
00064 unsigned int tlm_extension<T>::ID = tlm_extension_base::register_extension();
00065 
00066 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00067 // enumeration types
00068 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00069 enum tlm_command {
00070     TLM_READ_COMMAND,
00071     TLM_WRITE_COMMAND,
00072     TLM_NOP
00073 };
00074 
00075 enum tlm_burst_mode {
00076     TLM_INCREMENT_BURST,
00077     TLM_STREAMING_BURST,
00078     TLM_WRAPPING_BURST
00079 };
00080 
00081 enum tlm_response_status {
00082     TLM_OK_RESP = 1,
00083     TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESP = 0,
00084     TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESP = -1,
00085     TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESP = -2,
00086     TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESP = -3,
00087     TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESP = -4
00088 };

00090 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00091 // The generic payload class:
00092 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00093 class tlm_generic_payload {
00094 public:
00095 
00096     //---------------
00097     // Constructors
00098     //---------------
00099     
00100     // Default constructor
00101     tlm_generic_payload() 
00102         : m_command(TLM_NOP)
00103         , m_address(0)
00104         , m_data(0)
00105         , m_burst_length(1)
00106         , m_burst_data_size(0)
00107         , m_burst_mode(TLM_INCREMENT_BURST)
00108         , m_response_status(TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESP)
00109         , m_extensions(max_num_extensions())
00110         , mDMI(false)
00111     {
00112     }
00113     
00114     // FIXME: copy constructor, assignment operator, ... NOT needed
00115     
00116     //--------------
00117     // Destructor
00118     //--------------
00119     virtual ~tlm_generic_payload() {}
00120     
00121     //----------------
00122     // Setters & getters
00123     //---------------
00124     
00125     tlm_command         get_command()         const {return m_command;}
00126     sc_dt::uint64       get_address()         const {return m_address;}
00127     unsigned int        get_burst_length()    const {return m_burst_length;}
00128     unsigned int        get_burst_data_size() const {return m_burst_data_size;}
00129     tlm_burst_mode      get_burst_mode()      const {return m_burst_mode;}
00130     unsigned char*      get_data_ptr()        const {return m_data;}
00131     tlm_response_status get_response_status() const {return m_response_status;}
00132     bool                get_lock()            const {return m_lock;}
00133     
00134     void set_command(const tlm_command command)
00135         {m_command = command;}
00136     void set_address(const sc_dt::uint64 address)
00137         {m_address = address;}
00138     void set_burst_length(const unsigned int burst_length)
00139         {m_burst_length = burst_length;}
00140     void set_burst_data_size(const unsigned int burst_data_size)
00141         {m_burst_data_size = burst_data_size;}
00142     void set_burst_mode(const tlm_burst_mode burst_mode)
00143         {m_burst_mode = burst_mode;}
00144     void set_data_ptr(unsigned char* data)
00145         {m_data = data;}
00146     void set_response_status(const tlm_response_status response_status)
00147         {m_response_status = response_status;}  
00148         void set_lock(const bool lock)
00149             {m_lock = lock;}
00150     
00151     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00152     /* Generic Payload attributes:                                           */
00153     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00154     /* - m_command         : Type of transaction. Three values supported:    */
00155     /*                       - TLM_WRITE_COMMAND                             */
00156     /*                       - TLM_READ_COMMAND                              */
00157     /*                       - TLM_NOP                                       */
00158     /* - m_address         : Transaction base address (byte-addressing).     */
00159     /* - m_data            : When m_command = TLM_WRITE_COMMAND contains a   */
00160     /*                       pointer to the data to be written in the target.*/
00161     /*                       When m_command = TLM_READ_COMMAND contains a    */
00162     /*                       pointer where to copy the data read from the    */
00163     /*                       target.                                         */
00164     /* - m_burst_length    : Number of data transfers in the transaction.    */
00165     /*                               This is an element count, not a byte count.     */
00166     /*                       Size in bytes of each data transfer is indicated*/
00167     /*                       by the burst_data_size attribute.               */
00168     /* - m_burst_data_size : Size in bytes of each data transfer in the      */
00169     /*                       burst. It has to be smaller than or equal to    */
00170     /*                       the data size of the port/socket that initiates */
00171     /*                       the transaction.                                */
00172     /* - m_burst_mode      : Indicates how address has to be incremented for */
00173     /*                       each data transfer in the burst.                */
00174     /*                       Three modes supported:                          */
00175     /*                             - TLM_INCREMENT_BURST                     */
00176     /*                             - TLM_STREAMING_BURST                     */
00177     /*                             - TLM_WRAPPING_BURST                      */
00178     /* - m_response_status : This attribute indicates whether an error has   */
00179     /*                       occurred during the transaction.                */
00180     /*                       Values supported are: TBD                       */
00181     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00182     tlm_command          m_command;
00183     sc_dt::uint64        m_address;                     
00184     unsigned char*       m_data;
00185     unsigned int         m_burst_length;                
00186     unsigned int         m_burst_data_size;     
00187     tlm_burst_mode       m_burst_mode;
00188     tlm_response_status  m_response_status;
00189     bool                 m_lock;
00190 
00191     // unsigned int*        m_byte_enable
00192     // int                  m_identifier
00193     
00194 public:
00195 
00196    
00197     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00198     /* Dynamic extension mechanism:                                          */
00199     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00200     /* The extension mechanism is intended to enable initiator modules to    */
00201     /* optionally and transparently add data fields to the                   */
00202     /* tlm_generic_payload. Target modules are free to check for extensions  */
00203     /* and may or may not react to the data in the extension fields. The     */
00204     /* definition of the extensions' semantics is solely in the              */
00205     /* responsibility of the user.                                           */
00206     /*                                                                       */
00207     /* The following rules apply:                                            */
00208     /*                                                                       */
00209     /* - Every extension class must be derived from tlm_extension, e.g.:     */
00210     /*     class my_extension : public tlm_extension<my_extension> { ... }   */
00211     /*                                                                       */
00212     /* - A tlm_generic_payload object should be constructed after C++        */
00213     /*   static initialization time. This way it is guaranteed that the      */
00214     /*   extension array is of sufficient size to hold all possible          */
00215     /*   extensions. Alternatively, the initiator module can enforce a valid */
00216     /*   extension array size by calling the resize_extensions() method      */
00217     /*   once before the first transaction with the payload object is        */
00218     /*   initiated.                                                          */
00219     /*                                                                       */
00220     /* - Initiators should use the the set_extension(e) or clear_extension(e)*/
00221     /*   methods for manipulating the extension array. The type of the       */
00222     /*   argument must be a pointer to the specific registered extension     */
00223     /*   type (my_extension in the above example) and is used to             */
00224     /*   automatically locate the appropriate index in the array.            */
00225     /*                                                                       */
00226     /* - Targets can check for a specific extension by calling               */
00227     /*   get_extension(e). e will point to zero if the extension is not      */
00228     /*   present.                                                            */
00229     /*                                                                       */
00230     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00231 
00232     // Stick the pointer to an extension into the vector:
00233     template <typename T> void set_extension(T* ext)
00234     {
00235         resize_extensions();
00236         m_extensions[T::ID] = static_cast<tlm_extension_base*>(ext);
00237     }
00238     // non-templatized version with manual index:
00239     void set_extension(unsigned int index, tlm_extension_base* ext)
00240     {
00241         resize_extensions();
00242         m_extensions[index] = ext;
00243     }
00244 
00245     // Check for an extension, ext will point to 0 if not present
00246     template <typename T> void get_extension(T*& ext)
00247     {
00248         ext = static_cast<T*>(m_extensions[T::ID]);
00249     }
00250     // Non-templatized version:
00251      tlm_extension_base* get_extension(unsigned int index)
00252     {
00253         return m_extensions[index];
00254     }
00255 
00256     // Clear extension, the argument is needed to find the right index:
00257     template <typename T> void clear_extension(const T* ext)
00258     {
00259         resize_extensions();
00260         m_extensions[T::ID] = static_cast<tlm_extension_base*>(0);
00261     }
00262     // Non-templatized version with manual index
00263     void clear_extension(unsigned int index)
00264     {
00265         if (index < m_extensions.size())
00266         {
00267             m_extensions[index] = static_cast<tlm_extension_base*>(0);
00268         }
00269     }
00270 
00271     // Make sure the extension array is large enough. Can be called once by
00272     // an initiator module (before issuing the first transaction) to make
00273     // sure that the extension array is of correct size. This is only needed
00274     // if the initiator cannot guarantee that the generic payload object is
00275     // allocated after C++ static construction time.
00276     void resize_extensions()
00277     {
00278         m_extensions.expand(max_num_extensions());
00279     }
00280 
00281 protected:
00282     tlm_array<tlm_extension_base*> m_extensions;
00283 
00284 public:
00285   // This is the "DMI-hint" a slave can set this to true if it
00286   // wants to indicate that a DMI request would be supported:
00287   void set_dmi_allowed(bool dmiAllowed) { mDMI = dmiAllowed; }
00288   bool get_dmi_allowed() const { return mDMI; }
00289 
00290 protected:
00291   bool mDMI;
00292 };
00293

00295 #endif /* TLM_GP_HEADER */
